abstracts.cdata!:
This paper seeks approval of the
            Regional Vice President (RVP) to extend the closing date for
            the Infrastructure Reconstruction Enabling Program (IREP)
            until December 31, 2011. IREP is financed through a grant of
            US$42.0 million from the Multi-Donor Trust Fund for Aceh and
            North Sumatra (MDF). The date of the grant agreement is July
            13, 2006. The original closing date was October 31, 2009,
            and has already been extended once until June 30, 2010. The
            extension is for a cumulative period of 26 months, and
            requires approval of the RVP under BP13.30. IREP's main
            objective is to enable the implementation of the
            Infrastructure Reconstruction Financing Facility (IRFF) by
            financing the technical assistance needed to perform the
            project implementation management activities including:
            procurement; financial management; quality control and
            quality assurance; safeguards framework assurance and
            monitoring; implementation monitoring; and the design and
            construction supervision of all activities under the IRFF.
            The IREP and IRFF projects are designed to go hand-in-hand.
            Extending the closing date of IREP to coincide with
            IRFF's new closing date is needed to continue providing
            implementation support towards satisfactory completion of
            all remaining works and achievement of the development
            objectives of the Aceh reconstruction.
